Hidden Markov Model simulation with normal data.

Source: R/MCMC_normal.R
hmm_simulate_normal_data.Rd

Simulate a Hidden Markov Model based on normal data.

Usage

hmm_simulate_normal_data(L, mat_T, means, sigma)

Arguments

L

(integer) number of simulations

mat_T

(matrix) a square matrix with the initial state

means

(numeric) mean parameter in rnorm for emission probabilities

sigma

(numeric) sd parameter in rnorm for emission probabilities

Value

returns a data vector "data", the "true" hidden states "states" used to generate the data vector and prior probability of states "pi".

Examples

mat_T0 <- rbind(c(1-0.01,0.01,0),
               c(0.01,1-0.02,0.01),
               c(0,0.01,1-0.01))
L <- 2^5
means0 <- c(-1,0,1)
sigma0 <- 1

sim_data <- hmm_simulate_normal_data(L = L, mat_T = mat_T0, means = means0, sigma = sigma0)
plot(density(sim_data$data), main = "Density")

sim_data
#> $data
#>  [1] -1.54772330  1.04625824  1.85338838  1.88642794  0.48883380  0.21092279
#>  [7]  1.07350691  1.29204353  0.28126019  2.03836324  1.34291876 -1.77130533
#> [13]  1.10821911 -0.57518416  1.59598183  2.06745233  1.59031985  0.92812893
#> [19]  0.68751154  1.16281744  0.45081246 -0.01183488  0.10861619  1.86189959
#> [25]  0.01458110  0.61814690  1.25564904  1.21182166  0.35175981  2.25787886
#> [31]  2.63185066  3.24241426
#> 
#> $states
#>  [1] 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3
#> Levels: 1 2 3
#> 
#> $pi
#> [1] 0.3333333 0.3333333 0.3333333
#>
